alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 28 at 9:16AM EST until January 30 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM SATURDAY TO 7 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 11 to 18 inches expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 to 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Coastal DownEast, Interior DownEast and Penobscot Valley Maine. * WHEN...From 7 AM Saturday to 7 AM EST Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be extremely dangerous. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and powerlines.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
